"This ability, the unknown one." You begin to ask about the unknown ability you have, but aren't sure how to vocalize it. You use your UI to project your skill menu onto the table, and point at it for the fortune teller.

"Mm, yes."

The conversation stalls. The NPC appears as if they're beginning to speak; then, their animations abruptly reset with a noticeable twitch.

They go through that same un-nerving smile from before, repeating the phrase, intoned the same way.

"Strange, that you would fancy this meeting when our futures are so murky."

You pause, instinctively blurting. "What?"

"One can see many things in the ether, and learn more from the Celestials. Uncover their artifacts by searching carefully in your travels through dangerous locations, and you will find the truth in a matter of time." They tilt their head. "My sight is much vaster than many. Clear your mind, child, and allow me to alleviate your worries. Where shall I direct my gaze?"

> Ask about the ruins below.
> Ask about a player by name.
> Ask about a skill, ability, or archetype by name.
> Ask about a Celestial Artifact by name or owner.
> It seems pretty rigid, but you could try to ask about something else. (Write-in)
> Ask for a refund.
